thread.title: Dr Subra: Govt to continue providing high level of health care
thread.title_full: Dr Subra: Govt to continue providing high level of health care - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Dr Subra: Govt to continue providing high level of health care
text:
PETALING JAYA: Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr S Subramaniam has reassured Malaysians that they will continue to receive the "high level" of health care as before.
"Malaysians who have been enjoying free and highly subsided health care will continue to receive these services," said Dr Subramaniam in a statement on Wednesday.
As of Jan 1, the revised rates for first and second-class medical treatment were implemented at government hospitals.
Charges for first-class treatment would see an increase of 50 per cent, while second-class patients would pay 25 per cent more.
"The Cabinet has decided to review some charges for the first and second-class patients, as these charges have not been reviewed for a long time," said Dr Subramaniam.
Third-class patients will continue to receive free medical care as before.
"I will like to reassure all Malaysians that the government will not abrogate its responsibility to the poor and those from the low income group," he said.
"They will continue to receive the high level of care that they have been receiving as before," said Dr Subramaniam.
Previously, the minimum daily charges for first and second-class wards at government hospitals were RM30 and RM20 respectively.
Under the revised fees, the minimum daily rate for first class will be RM45 and RM25 for second class.
There will be no changes for third-class medical treatment, with its minimum fee of RM3.
Charges for outpatient treatment at government hospitals and health clinics will remain at RM1 and RM5 respectively.
The government has given an exemption to elderly patients with a charge reduction of 50 per cent, if admitted.
Other groups that have been exempted from paying medical treatment in government hospitals include people with disabilities, students and organ donors.
